metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15903 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libexpat before 2.2.8, crafted XML input could fool the parser into changing from DTD parsing to document parsing too early; a consecutive call to XML_GetCurrentLineNumber (or XML_GetCurrentColumnNumber) then resulted in a heap-based buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.70-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required
